newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Polish Deputy PM says NATO costs manageable.
newsitem.headline: Polish Deputy PM says NATO costs manageable.

text.p: Poland's military budget will be able to easily absorb costs related to the country's prospective membership in NATO, Deputy Prime Minister Marek Belka said on Thursday.

"Of course, there are some immediate costs connected with NATO membership...but this is not huge. This is something that can be borne by the military budget alone easily," Belka, who is also the country's finance minister, told Reuters Financial Television in an interview.
Belka, who was attending the second Central and Eastern European summit in Salzburg, said the costs would amount to roughly $100 to $200 million annually but would be spread out over several years.
Most of the money would go to upgrade the country's telecommunications and command systems to make them compatible with the North Atlantic Treat Organisation's (NATO) standards.
NATO earlier this week invited Poland, the Czech Republic and Hungary to join the Western defence alliance in 1999.
